tn.ref: When King Darius had been ruler for four years
tn.text: "in the fourth year since Darius became king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: on the fourth day of Kislev (which was the ninth month)
tn.text: "Kislev" is the ninth month of the Hebrew calendar. The fourth day is near the end of November on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:zec:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]).
The word "they" refers to Sharezer and Regem Melech.

The Jewish people fasted during a part of the fifth month of the Hebrew calendar because this is when the Babylonians destroyed the temple in Jerusalem. The fifth month is during the last part of July and the first part of August on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
AT: "in the fifth month" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

The Jews mourned during a part of the seventh month of the Hebrew calendar because in this month the remaining Jews in Jerusalem fled to Egypt after the murder of Gedaliah, whom the king of Babylon appointed as governor over Judah. The seventh month is during the last part of September and the first part of October on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
The people of Israel had been slaves in Babylon for 70 years. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This phrase refers to when they ate and drank at feasts to honor how Yahweh had provided for them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: were you truly fasting for me?
tn.text: This question is used to accuse the people of Israel for not honoring Yahweh when they fasted. AT: "you did not fast to honor me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: did you not eat and drink for yourselves?
tn.text: This question is used to accuse the people of Israel who celebrated the feasts for not honoring God with their feasting. AT: "it was for yourselves that you ate and drank" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Yahweh proclaimed by the mouth of the former prophets
tn.text: Zechariah refers to the former prophets by referring to the part of their body that spoke Yahweh's message. AT: "Yahweh proclaimed through the former prophets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: Were these not the same words ... to the west?
tn.text: This question can be written as a statement. "These were exactly the same words ... to the west." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"lived in"
These are the small hills that are before you get to the mountains.
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:zec:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The word "this" refers to how a person should judge.
a woman whose husband has died
a child whose parents have died
someone who travels from his own land to a different land

tn.ref: let none of you plot any harm against another in your heart
tn.text: "you must not make plans to do evil"
AT: "they were like cattle that refused to be yoked" or "they were like cattle that refused to obey" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"They closed up their ears"

tn.ref: They made their hearts as hard as rock
tn.text: AT: "They made up their minds to reject Yahweh's messages" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: by the mouth of the prophets
tn.text: AT: "through the words of the prophets"

tn.ref: I will scatter them with a whirlwind
tn.text: AT: "I will scatter them as a whirlwind scatters leaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
a very strong wind that spins as it goes, scattering things all around
